item.title: Russian Vine, 4th October
item.description:
Blackheath Golf course backs onto my garden. They have a very invasive Russian Vine it has covered all the trees over 30ft . I’ve had roots coming under my fence and I have to keep cuttings it from my fence. In the past I have had two trees fallen into my garden one was over 100ft and broke fence and shed. I’ve asked many times if they can sort the Russian Vine but it’s just spreading and completely covering the trees . Can you ask them to sort it out. Thank yoy

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 168, Green Lane, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped and obstructing pathway, 4th October
item.description:
This rubbish and waste has been here for over a month now ive reported it a number of times to fix my street and the councillors and still it remains outside my property. I feel that its unfair to have to wake up to this everyday and new we have an added issue where by foxes are contaminating and leaving feaces everywhere on it too. Please help with this ongoing issue and get it removed asap. I do believe that my neighbours have paid to have items removed and now we have additional flytipping added to it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coupland Place, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gaza flag flying over basketball court., 4th October
item.description:
This morning a Palestinian flag has appeared over the sports court in London Fields. Please could this be removed as soon as possible.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rochford Walk, Hackney, London

item.title: Greenwich Council litter, 4th October
item.description:
Greenwich council maintenance team not picking up swept litter. This hasn’t been collected for more than three weeks and is now bags are being ripped open by animals and spilling out onto the street. Please clear this up immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roydene Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Heavy build up of fallen leaves, now turned to slippery mush, 4th October
item.description:
Excessive build up of fallen leaves along Anerley Park Road, which have now started to turn into slippery mush which is dangerous under foot in wet weather. Leaves also starting to block up street drainage. Need to be swept and cleared up and down street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Anerley Park Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
